Plenty of Furballs

\n\n

\n About 6 million companion animals enter animal shelters nationwide every year. \n Of those, approximately 3 million are dogs and 3 million are cats.

\n Please reconsider purchasing your pets from a retail store or breeder.\n

\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n \n
\n\n
\n

Happy & Healthy

\n\n

\n Many shelters provide a full health screen that includes vaccinations, parasite treatment, \n and spay/neuter surgery, all covered in the adoption fee.

\n If services are not provided, a free veterinary visit often is included in the adoption fee.\n

\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n \n
\n\n
\n

No Pet Left Behind

\n\n

\n Organizations like animal shelters, humane societies, and rescue leagues will \n house and care for owner-surrendered, abandoned, stray and injured animals.

\n Many organizations also rehabilitate abused animals to help them recover and find a loving home.\n

\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n \n
\n\n
\n

Helter Shelter

\n

\n The Helter-Shelter Map below contains pinned locations throughout New Hampshire. \n You can click on each pin to find the name and location of each organization.

\n Can you find your local animal shelter on the map?\n
